alert.note: Alert for Lenawee; Livingston; Macomb; Monroe; Oakland; Washtenaw; Wayne (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 09 at 6:10PM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...CAUTIOUS TRAVEL IS ADVISED FOR REDUCED VISIBILITIES IN FALLING WET SNOW THIS EVENING... WEATHER... * Brief bursts of wet snow will be possible through 8 PM for areas along and south of the M-59 corridor, including the greater Detroit metro region, Ann Arbor, and further south to the Ohio border. Precipitation type will also occur in the form of a rain/snow mix across portions of the region. * Quick wet snow accumulations up to a half of an inch, primarily on grassy surfaces, will be possible in the bursts of wet snow. * Visibility may be reduced to below 1/2 mile at times. * Temperatures will range from the mid to upper 30s, cooling closer to freezing as precipitation moves through. IMPACTS... * Reduced and variable visibility will be possible in areas of wet snow. Motorists should take caution if traveling this evening. * While roadways will generally remain wet, typically susceptible surfaces such as overpasses, on-ramps, bridges, and sidewalks may get slushy with a dusting to a few tenths of an inch of wet snow accumulation. && PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... * Motorists are urged to use caution and account for the variable driving conditions by allowing extra time. * Prepare, plan and stay informed. Visit http://go.usa.gov/c7kkP
